extendedIngredients.aisle: Pasta and Rice;Canned and Jarred;Ethnic Foods
extendedIngredients.name: chickpeas
fennel bulb
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 small fennel bulb, quartered and thinly sliced (1 cup)

extendedIngredients.name: olive oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2½ tsp. olive oil, divided, plus more for drizzling

extendedIngredients.name: red onion
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 small red onion, quartered and thinly sliced (1 cup)

extendedIngredients.name: roasted red peppers
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 jarred roasted red peppers, drained and cut into 2-inch strips

recipes.title: Cauliflower and Chickpeas with Ras El Hanout en Papillote
recipes.instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400°F. Cut 4  15-inch lengths of parchment paper,  and fold each in half. Set aside.2. Place couscous in bowl, and add  salt (if using). Pour 1 cup boiling water over couscous, cover, and let stand  3 minutes. Stir in 1/2 tsp. oil, and set aside.3. Toss together cauliflower, fennel, onion, chickpeas, ras el hanout, lemon juice, garlic, and remaining 2 tsp. oil  in bowl.4. Open folded parchment sheets  like a book, and spoon 1/2 cup couscous  to one side of crease. Top each serving with 1 heaping cup cauliflower mixture. Lay red pepper strips over cauliflower mixture, and sprinkle with dates. Fold parchment over food so edges meet, then crimp and seal edges with small overlapping diagonal folds (see “Classic French Fold,” below).5. Transfer packets to large baking sheet, and bake 20 minutes. Cool  2 minutes before serving. Garnish with lemon wedges.Classic French FoldFold 15-inch length of parchment paper in half, then open like a book, and place food to one side of crease. Fold empty side over food so ends meet. Crimp and seal matched edges with small overlapping diagonal folds.

steps.step: Cut 4  15-inch lengths of parchment paper,  and fold each in half. Set aside.2.
Place couscous in bowl, and add  salt (if using).

Pour 1 cup boiling water over couscous, cover, and let stand  3 minutes. Stir in 1/2 tsp. oil, and set aside.3. Toss together cauliflower, fennel, onion, chickpeas, ras el hanout, lemon juice, garlic, and remaining 2 tsp. oil  in bowl.4. Open folded parchment sheets  like a book, and spoon 1/2 cup couscous  to one side of crease. Top each serving with 1 heaping cup cauliflower mixture. Lay red pepper strips over cauliflower mixture, and sprinkle with dates. Fold parchment over food so edges meet, then crimp and seal edges with small overlapping diagonal folds (see “Classic French Fold,” below).5.
Transfer packets to large baking sheet, and bake 20 minutes. Cool  2 minutes before serving.
Garnish with lemon wedges.Classic French Fold

Fold 15-inch length of parchment paper in half, then open like a book, and place food to one side of crease. Fold empty side over food so ends meet. Crimp and seal matched edges with small overlapping diagonal folds.
